title: Winter Project: ChEmber
description: Ignite your passion for chemical engineering this winter! ChEmber (Chemical Engineering + Ember) is a project initiative focused on sparking innovation during the semester break.
details:
The ChEmber Winter Project is designed to let students dive deep into a specific area of chemical engineering. This is a student-led initiative where teams can choose to tackle a problem in one of several key fields. Potential project streams include:
- Process Simulation & Design: Model a complex chemical process using Aspen HYSYS or similar software.
- Sustainability & LCA: Conduct a Life Cycle Assessment of a product or process.
- Bioprocessing / Biotech: Design a bioreactor or a downstream purification process.
- Chemical Engineering Machine Learning: Work on a small transfer learning project applied to chemical data.
- Thermodynamics / Reaction Engineering: Investigate a complex reaction system or thermodynamic property model.
- Control System: Design and simulate a process control strategy using MATLAB/Simulink.

title: Summer Project: ChEclipse
description: Uncover new ideas this summer with ChEclipse (Chemical + Eclipse), a project initiative that brings light to challenging engineering problems.
details:
The ChEclipse Summer Project offers a chance to explore cutting-edge topics in chemical engineering in collaboration with faculty advisors. This initiative encourages students to tackle research-oriented or design-based challenges. Potential project fields for this summer include:
- Cooling & Process Engineering: Design an energy-efficient cooling system for data centers or industrial processes.
- Green Chemistry & Thermodynamics: Develop and model a process using green solvents or sustainable reaction pathways.
- Bioengineering & Cooling: Explore bio-inspired cooling mechanisms or the thermal management of bioreactors.
- Semiconductors, Materials and AI: Investigate new materials for semiconductor manufacturing or apply AI to predict material properties.
